greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array T(n,k) read by antidiagonals up: T(n,k) = 1 if n=1; otherwise if n divides k then T(n,k) = -n+1; otherwise T(n,k) = 1.
comment: Replace the first column in A077049 with any k-th column in A177121 (this array) to get a new array. Then the matrix inverse of the new array will have the k-th column of A054535 (Ramanujan sum) as its first column.
Obtained from A176079 by transposing, flipping signs, and adding a lower triangle of all -1's. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 08 2011
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65703 (the first 362 antidiagonals of array)
formula: T(n,k) = 1 if n=1; otherwise, if n divides k then T(n,k) = -n+1; otherwise T(n,k) = 1.
program: A177121list(up_to) = { my(v = vector(up_to), i=0); for(a=1,oo, for(col=1,a, if(i++ > up_to, return(v)); v[i] = A177121sq((a-(col-1)),col))); (v); };
results.author: _Mats Granvik_ and _Gary W. Adamson_, May 03 2010
